title: As it happened: Canadian election 2015 - BBC News
summary: liberal party leader justin trudeau will be the next prime minister of canada .
the liberal party have won more than 170 seats in parliament and will form a majority government .
the election was largely seen as a referendum on incumbent conservative pm stephen harper .
tom mulcair and the new democratic party suffered the heaviest losses of the night .

documents.title: goodnight
text: that 's a wrap on our live coverage of # elxn42 .
thanks for sticking with us !

documents.title: young canadians ' hopes and fears for a new era
text: as canada elects one of its youngest prime ministers , justin trudeau , what are the hopes and dreams of young voters for this new era ?
to find out what this new millennial generation cares about most , bbc pop up partnered with the smartphone app yik yak , asking `` how will this election affect you ?
we had thousands of responses to our polls and questions .
read the full results here .

documents.title: a first for canada
text: ctv news : trudeau 's win ushers in canada 's first political dynasty
canadians ushered in their first political dynasty in the country 's history on monday night , when the son of former prime minister pierre elliott trudeau was elected with a majority mandate .

documents.title: conservative blue turns to liberal red in toronto
text: the liberal party made dramatic gains in the toronto area in monday 's election .

documents.title: a hoarse trudeau thanks his supporters
text: justin trudeau hoarsely delivered a lengthy victory speech , saying `` this is what positive politics can do '' .
amid cheers of `` justin !
justin !
justin !
`` , mr trudeau said politics do not have to be negative to be successful and that canadians sent a clear message that it 's time for a change .
`` you can appeal to the better angels of our nature and you can win while doing that , '' he said , referencing an abraham lincoln quote .
he thanked former conservative leader and prime minister stephen harper for his 10 years of service and said conservatives `` are not our enemies-they 're our neighbours . ''
`` we won this election because we listened we can make anything happen if we put our minds to it and work hard .
i 'm not the one who made history tonight - you are , '' mr trudeau said .
he mentioned championing the rights of indigenous peoples and preserving the rights of canadians to make their own choices , referencing the niqab debate .
`` we beat fear with hope .
we beat cynicism with hard work .
we beat negative politics .
in canada , better is always possible , '' he said .

documents.title: harper says goodbye
text: the people are never wrong

documents.title: trudeau triumphant
text: you can appeal to the better angels of our nature , and you can win while doing it

documents.title: future uncertain for mulcair
text: after a tight race , new democratic party leader thomas mulcair has held on to his seat in parliament .
however his future as party leader is in doubt after a disastrous election night for the ndp .
canadians have turned the page on 10 long years

documents.title: harper congratulates trudeau and thanks supporters
text: former conservative leader and prime minister stephen harper has wrapped up his speech to supporters after losing to liberal leader justin trudeau .
`` [ my wife and i ] decided to go into public life because [ we ] thought hard-working canadians should keep more of the money they earn , '' said mr harper .
`` in a dangerous world , canada must defend our values and stand by our friends . ''
`` we gave everything we had to give , and we have no regrets whatsoever .
how could we ?
we remain citizens of the best country on earth . ''
he said he accepted the results of the election `` without hesitation '' and offered mr trudeau his congratulations , offering him his `` full cooperation . ''

documents.title: harper ready to concede
text: stephen harper will step down as conservative leader after monday 's federal election defeat , a conservative party official tells the bbc .

documents.title: president nixon predicts the future
text: us president richard nixon made a spot-on prediction at a gala buffet in april 1972 during a state visit to ottawa when justin trudeau was just four months old .
tonight we 'll dispense with the formalities .
i 'd like to toast the future prime minister of canada : to justin pierre trudeau

documents.title: is the niqab debate finally over ?
text: stephen harper 's unwavering support of a law that would prevent muslim women from wearing traditional face coverings when taking an oath of canadian citizenship may have backfired .
many voters turned to other candidates due to the extremity of mr harper 's position , which some called racist .
presumptive winner justin trudeau does not support the niqab law .

documents.title: 'history in the making'anthony zurcher , north america reporter in montreal
text: it has become a night of superlatives for the liberals in canada .
for only the second time in history , a party has gone from third place in parliament to first .
the liberals control more seats in quebec than they 've had in a generation , dealing a crushing blow to the formerly ascendent left-leaning new democratic party .
they won at least one race in the conservative fortress of calgary , hometown of prime minister stephen harper , for the first time since 1968 .
justin trudeau campaigned as a candidate of change , and his party is poised to hand the incumbent conservatives one of the worst defeats in their history .
at liberal party headquarters in montreal , the mood has gone from excitement to pure jubilation , as the crowd cheers win after improbable win .
i 'm so excited , '' said karyn decore , who flew in from edmonton - another conservative alberta city that could send a liberal to parliament - for monday night 's party .
i could feel in my heart that change was coming .
this is history in the making . ''

text: updated seat counts

documents.title: candidates expected to speak soon
text: candidates expected to speak soon

documents.title: a big change on climate change
text: justin trudeau has promised to change canada 's stance on environmental issues by actively working to combat climate change .
as prime minister , he would attend the international summit on climate change in paris in december .
many think stephen harper had damaged canada 's reputation on the environment , saying he would not attend the summit .

documents.title: congratulations pour in
text: congratulations pour in

documents.title: the good , the bad and the ugly
text: scenes from the party headquarters as the results come in .

documents.title: trudeau in blue
text: twitter has combined the biggest stories in canada right now - the blue jays and justin trudeau

documents.title: full circle for harper ?
text: full circle for harper ?

documents.title: 'a tattoo is for life '
text: the bbc 's franz strasser profiles a canadian tattoo parlour that challenged politicians stephen harper , justin trudeau and tom mulcair to ink their election pledges onto their bodies .
`` a tattoo is for life - and so is a promise '' is its message .

documents.title: requiem for stephen harper
text: stephen harper may have at least won in his own riding , but as ctv news ' don martin wrote , `` this is not an election , it 's a harperendum . ''
mr harper made his foreign policy platforms crystal clear , championed small government and lower taxes and made himself the face of the conservative party for many years .
ultimately , canadians seem to be ready for a change .
many are speculating that the election was more about voters saying `` no more '' to harper 's divisive politics rather than deciding on individual issues .

documents.title: canadian media now project liberal majority
text: the cbc and ctv have projected that justin trudeau will form a majority government .
the liberal party has made a dramatic comeback winning more than 170 seats after only holding 34 seating in the last election .

documents.title: oh canada !
text: oh canada !

documents.title: the map is taking shape
text: the map is taking shape

documents.title: a bad night for the ndp
text: stephen harper and the conservatives may be out of power .
but things look even worse for the ndp .
the liberals ' huge gains seem to be coming at the expense of tom mulcair 's party .

documents.title: harper 's heartland
text: results have yet to come in from the west .
but bbc pop up was just in alberta and sent us this soothing video as an escape from tonight 's political drama .

documents.title: 'viva justin trudeau ! 'anthony zurcher , bbc north america reporter in montreal
text: it was a fairly empty room here at liberal party campaign headquarters when canadian television announced that justin trudeau would be the next prime minster of canada , but those in attendance cheered heartily when they heard the news .

it has n't taken long for supporters to begin showing up in droves , however , crowding around a stage bathed in liberal party red , in anticipation of a justin trudeau victory speech sometime later tonight .
as national television cameras broadcast the scene , one supporter shouted : viva justin trudeau !
viva canada ! ''
it feels fantastic , '' said michael wright , who drove to the montreal from ottawa because he believed liberals were poised for victory .
like many of the canadian voters who recently told pollsters they were opting for change , he says he 's happiest about conservative prime minister stephen harper 's impending defeat .
i wish him luck in his gardening in alberta , '' he says with a laugh .

documents.title: liberals closing in on majority status , cbc says
text: cbc projections show the liberal party is leading with 165 seats .
the liberals need 170 seats to secure a majority government .

documents.title: the 'red wave ' continues
text: the final polls have closed on the west coast in canada .
and more good news keeps coming in for the liberal party .

documents.title: mulcair may lose his seat
text: early results show new democratic party leader thomas mulcair is in trouble .
he could lose his riding in outremont .

text: supporters react to early projections

documents.title: canadian media projecting pm trudeau
text: both the cbc and ctv are projecting that liberal party leader justin trudeau will be the next prime minister of canada .
still unsure whether the government will be a majority government .
cheers have broken out at liberal headquarters in montreal .

documents.title: canada in your five words : 'best country in the world '
text: when bbc pop up asked canadians to sum up your country in five words , thousands of you responded via email , facebook and twitter .
here are just a few of our favourites :
`` simply put .
greatest .
country .
ever . ''
jaythecanadian
`` wonderful place needs better politicians ! ''
( mike stewart )
`` proud enough to be polite . ''
( shirley desserud )
`` american .
want to move there . ''
( lindsay )
watch more of your five-word suggestions by playing the video in the black box below .
this content only works in the uk .

documents.title: 'red wave ' plays out on twitter
text: as the liberals swept atlantic canada , so did the colour red all over twitter .

documents.title: 'sea change '
text: a sea of change here .
we are used to high tides in atlantic canada .
this is not what we hoped for .

documents.title: record turnout reported
text: voters stood in long lines at polling places in the early part of the night .

documents.title: strange bedfellows
text: stephen harper enlisted an unlikely ally to rally more votes in the run-up to election day - rob ford .
ford , former mayor of toronto , made international headlines when he admitted to using crack cocaine while in office .
ford seems like a odd surrogate for law-and-order focused and straight-laced harper , but the controversial former mayor still has supporters despite his tarnished image .
harper is apparently betting that ford 's pros outweigh his cons .

text: conservatives are n't the only ones in trouble

text: the canadian media uses red to represent the liberal party .
conservatives show up as blue .
while orange is the color of new democratic party .

documents.title: the hard man vs the pretty boy
text: canada election : pm stephen harper 's final stand
the bbc 's anthony zurcher takes a look at stephen harper 's last-minute ploys to stay in office .
if there is a path to victory on monday for the prime minister making his last stand , it will be a long and narrow one .

text: the final push on election day

documents.title: early results are in
text: the polls have closed in atlantic canada .
the liberal party was expected to perform well here but analysts say the party is exceeding expectations .

documents.title: divided loyalties
text: canadians will have two major news events to contend with on monday - the election and a toronto blue jays ' playoff game .
the blue jays are hoping to turn their fortunes around after dropping two games to the kansas city royals .
game three of the american league championship series starts at 20:07 local time ( 00:07 gmt ) in toronto .
sadly for baseball fans , the election result and the climatic moment of the game may overlap .

documents.title: john oliver takes on the canadian elections
text: john oliver used comedian mike meyers , a beaver and a moose to dispel some advice to voters .

documents.title: who is justin trudeau ?
text: who is canadian liberal party leader justin trudeau ?
the bbc 's jessica lussenhop profiles the 43-year-old man who is currently leading in the polls .

stick with us as we bring you updates throughout the evening .
